Just a question for christian. I dunno where to put it, so i'll leave it in this main forum.
 
 Is incest prohibited in the bible? If so, then how come we are all the product of the incestual (is that a word?) relationship between the children of Adam and Eve? (assuming of course, that Adam and Eve ARE the humans that God created)
 
 Diagram:
 
 Adam + Eve =
 Son, Daughter, Son, Daughter (only logical way for more creation)
 
 Now, to create any more children, the son's and daughters would have to procreate, and then only would family lines can be created. (however, note, that even at this point, all share same blood-lines).
 
 Also, lack of genetic variation in inbreeding couples often leads to major mental and physical problems. Chances are, all the grandchildren of Adam and Eve would be unfit to survive. How is it that we all came from just two human beings?

following the stream of the genesis story, yes, the second generation would be a result of incestual relations between brothers and sisters, the third probably between cousins, our aunts and uncles with nephews and nieces, and with more generations there would be more "family distance". of course, being the genesis story, its not difficult to imagine that all the children would be healthy and normal, or any inbreeding mutations would be beneficial rather than harmful
 
 if you start off on the premise that God created adam and eve, and commanded them to be fruitful and multiply, then you should have no problem with the idea that they would all be protected from any potential abnormalities
 
 then again, not all inbred offspring are tainted, maybe some were and the bible just doesnt mention them...

 Actually, I've heard that the Genesis story conjures people in out of nowhere - just like a fictional story. The example I have heard of is Cain's wife.

Actually, I've heard that the Genesis story conjures people in out of nowhere - just like a fictional story. The example I have heard of is Cain's wife.

 
 Ever really studied it much?
 
 If we assume that Adam and Eve gave birth to other sons and daughters (one per year starting at 20 years of age), who had sons and daughters and so on, there could have been at least ten thousand people by the time Adam was 130 years old.
 
 In order to populate the earth, brothers and sisters had to marry each other. With a population in the thousands, marriages within the immediate family were not necessary. Further, the genetic problems associated with marriages within a family would take some time to develop. It was not until much later that God prohibited this type of marriage (sin is not reckoned until the law is given).

My two cents on this issue:
 
 The bible no where states that adam and eve were the only two humans created by God. It states that they are the archetype of human beings. A type, not the only. There is nothing contradictory in Cain having found a wife among others. The genesis account is not all inclusive. It does leave gaps in the historical record (as does any writing of historical items by the way. There is no absolutely complete account of everything that happened in WWII.)
 
 I don't see a problem with others being there.

 I will avoid your first paragraph so as not to turn this political.
 
 As for your second paragraph, The change is that He has spoken completely at this point in time. "In the beginning was the word.....The word was God and was with God.....The word became flesh and dwelt among us." It is the very thing we (christians) celebrate at christmas. He spoke the incarnation. God lived among people, spoke to us completely in His person and character. His final word was "Jesus" he needed no other one. I speak somewhat eupemistically here, but, it is the reason why God no longer communicates through his prophets. he gave us his son, He also gave us his bible, He also gave us His spirit. A prophet is no longer needed. "The spirit bears witness for us..." The truth is that now man has DIRECT access to God. Sin used to keep man at bay, becasue the time was not ripe for the full penalty to be paid. Man could not directly approach God as his sin was too great. God placed Moses in the cleft of the rock as His glory passed by to keep Moses from being consumed by it. The book of Hebrews says "we can come BOLDLY before the throne of grace." (emphasis mine). God speaks to the individual through his indwelling spirit. But he speaks to me about me. He does not deal with me about you. He deals with you directly. It is one of the reasons Christians should be the last to say anything about anothers sin. I have my own share to deal with. I truly haven't time to deal with yours ("remove the log from your own eye first, then you can see clearly to deal with your brothers")

Is incest prohibited in the bible? If so, then how come we are all the product of the incestual (is that a word?) relationship between the children of Adam and Eve? (assuming of course, that Adam and Eve ARE the humans that God created)
 
 Now, to create any more children, the son's and daughters would have to procreate, and then only would family lines can be created. (however, note, that even at this point, all share same blood-lines).
 
 Also, lack of genetic variation in inbreeding couples often leads to major mental and physical problems. Chances are, all the grandchildren of Adam and Eve would be unfit to survive. How is it that we all came from just two human beings?
 
 Incest is a modern word and is not used in the Bible. Not only does incest cover a whole range of things, some of which has always been immoral, but it also covers immoral relationships. But is there anything morally wrong about a man marrying a woman, provided that it is one man for one woman in the context of marriage? The answer is no! It is just like a man and a woman getting married today. Brothers marrying sisters was allowed up to the time of Moses. God then said that it was wrong to do so, there may have been a number of reasons for it, mainly because of the lack of genetic variation and the higher chance of mutations in the off spring (as you said).
 
 However, in the beginning, God created everything perfect - there were no mutations. When man sinned, God's creation started to fall apart and we started to fall apart. Mutations then started to happen. So after the Fall [of man] there would be relatively few mutations and so the chance of having a deformed child is very low, essentially zero. Also, keep in mind that mankind had been suffering the effects of the curse (that God placed on all creation after man sinned) for about two thousand years at the time of Moses which would have had far more mutations than just after the curse. 
 
 Adam and Eve had many, many children too. We are all "one blood". Interestingly enough, scientists working on the human genome project have also come to this conclusion that we are all one blood, i.e. one race - the human race (or Adam's race). Even in evolutionary perspective, close relatives had to marry originally...
